diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Permanent Neonatal Diabetes due to Paternal Germline Mosaicism for an Activating Mutation of the KCNJ11 Gene
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was established based on the identification of a heterozygous missense mutation (R201C) in the KCNJ11 gene in two paternal half-siblings. The mutation was not present in the unaffected father, indicating he was likely a mosaic for the mutation restricted to his germline, suggesting a genetic transmission of the mutation to his children.
